rComments: Similar to what most here have said on here about Healthcare Inequalities- it is hands down the best class you will take at UC, and Andrea makes it so.  I'm a Fem Studies major and heading for nursing school after I graduate. This class is incredibly important for anyone wanting to head into the healthcare public health health activism world.

Healthcare Inequalities with Andrea was one of the best classes I've taken at UCSC. Andrea is incredibly approachable, passionate, and knowledgeable. She does a fantastic job of facilitating respectful discussions on topics that can be difficult to talk about. There is a LOT of reading, but if you keep up with it, you can get a decent grade.

Andrea is one of the best teachers at UCSC in my opinion. Her lectures are usually very engaging and helpful with material, and I've left her class several times with a different outlook on life. She truly cares about her students, learns their names, is very approachable, and down-to-earth. Lots of reading, but take her class if you can

I love every class I've taken with Andrea! She's an amazing lecturer and really knows how to connect with students and initiate interesting conversations. Personally, I was never extremely interested in women's health but she made me really invested in the topic. Super easy to talk as well, if you take her class make sure to visit office hours!

Healthcare Inequalities w/ Andrea was a great experience for me. She is extremely knowledgable and passionate about her work. Andrea is friendly, approachable,genuine, funny and engaging. It can be hard to keep up with the workload but I learned so much in this class and it's even got me interested in doing postgrad work in the public health sector
DONT TAKE THIS CLASS! She is horrible! The class has noo direction at all.

Steiner is great! She is so nice and really has a passion for the material she is teaching. She helped me immensly on the final research paper and was personable and friendly in office hours. A great first upper div. to take.

Andrea is amazing. I really would not say she has "favorites" but that she is really open to making heart felt connections with her students, often treating them like peers. She is the best professor I have had at UCSC so far and really knows her****. She pushes you in all the right ways, while also being compassionate to your process! Shes great!

Okay, I love her but she is not at her best when in larger lectures. If you're lazy or you slack, you won't like her either. Steiner is amazing in seminars and smaller lectures. Take one if you have the chance. Her "favorites" are her favorites because she is their major advisor. You probably have one too. It's normal! Stop whining.
148 was alright. Keep in mind, this was the first time Steiner taught Women's Health Activism. Give her some slack.

I took Women's Health Activism & was very disappointed. Her lectures lack substance and provide a superficial analysis.  She has her favorites in the class and will play to them.  Lecture is full of problematic statements. She repeatedly says she is using a feminist lens but if you are expecting a sophisticated analysis don't take this class.

Seems like a nice lady... but she is a terrible professor. TERRIBLE at teaching large lectures. She has her favorites in the class... the material she teaches is interesting, but she isn't very much. Attendance is mandatory but pointless. PREPARE to do a lot of REDUNDANT reading.

This class should satisfy a W requirement! More writing and reading then I've done in the whole 4 years I've been at UCSC. Her tests & readings assignments are way too long with all that said she's still an great teacher.

She was really disrespectful to me.   I came down with a really bad illness and was unable to get out of bed for 4 weeks by order of my doctor because my liver was failing.  I sent her a doctors note and had to do my group project on my own.  She was very inconsiderate of my situation even though i turned in all the work she assigned. disrespectful
Andrea is one of the best teachers I've had.  She truly cares about the subject she is teaching and her enthusiasm makes you interested in the subject.  Great teacher, great material.

Andrea is an excellent and approachable teacher with a great sense of humor. You can tell that she's passionate about what she does and she's really on the students' side. I'd love to take another class from her. Mandatory attendance can be annoying, sure, but if you take good notes and do the reading she'll reward your effort and participation.

Andrea is absolutely amazing. She's personable, approachable and attentive. Don't be fooled by her bubbliness; she's very knowledgable about health care. In my personal experience, she's better in lectures than seminars. BIO89 is an amazing class and Steiner's class gives further proof that UCSC needs a Public Health major (!).
The sections for this class are important. The tests are tricky but if you study you're good to go. Make sure to pay attention to guest lecturers and her in class.

Very helpful + resourceful! Her appearance always seemed cheerful. She provided great opportunity + experience for students in understanding field of health care; addition by inviting lots of guests speakers. But too much guest speakers throw out balance of courses teaching which she began to speed up lecture.

Horrors of Old Age--Andrea is the best Professor I've had.  She is funny and down-to-earth.  She treats the students like equals, adults; with respect.  The class was fun, engaging and thought provoking without a huge amount of work.  The assignments were fun and interesting.  Loved the readings, films and guest speakers.

i was pretty excited to take this class based on the description in the catalog but the content turned out to be pretty drab and uninteresting. easy a, though, and not much work involved. two midterms and a final paper.

Very kind. She tried to remember your name if you participated in class. A little flakey (she skipped out on our group presentation and gave no reason) and disorganized however. She really cared about her students, I noticed how helpful she was, but she seemed to favor certain people.

Andrea led a very organized class that was really helpful for anyone thinking about going into the world of health care. I learned so much about insurance, social aspects of medicine, and about care in Santa Cruz. She was very helpful and was always available for talking about my concerns with the class and my major. Great professor!

the nicest teacher and one of the nicest people ive ever met. she is concerned with her students progress and her lectures are very open for student comments and questions. she loves teaching. the tests were good, not tricky, just do the reading. shes a lineant grader and for due dates too

One of the best classes I've taken. Class discussions were engaging, and the classroom community was great. The books were all really good, some individual articles weren't. She cares about every single student in the class and wants everyone to succeed. I was challenged, but learned so much. She provides academic support like few other 100 profs.
She's kind of all over the place. Whimsical? Not so great, really...kind of selective with students and she is not that engaging. BUT I did get an awesome grade in her class, so that was cool.
I love this woman!

She is a very nice person and does her best to help her students.  I didn't always agree with her grading.  I worked very hard in this class and got a lower grade then I think I deserved.  But she is very supportive of her students and probably has her reasons.

Andrea is great! Her door is always open and she cares about everyone. By the third day she knew everyone's names and what they wanted to focus on. She really wants you to succeed and to pass her class. On the otherhand, it is a challenging course and the only 100 that has a mid term, or so I am tol
great teacher, down to earth. I dont know what the others were talking about. The class was very inspirational.

Andrea, though smiley and friendly, is not the best teacher. She is very selective in choosing which students to talk to and spend time with concerning class work and projects. Huge ego. I also think she posted the other comment on here. She's weak.
Andrea is a great help to her students, very clear, and fair.
